name: Chicken Makhani
directions:
*Notes - 3 or 4 chicken breasts is all you need.  A double batch of sauce is a good amount.  Start the naan first, let rise on the cookie sheets while you do the rest.  A double batch of naan is too much, one batch is not enough so make two.  After the naan, make the tandoori chicken.  Once the chicken is in the oven, start the rice.  Once the chicken is out of the oven start the naan while you make the makhani sauce, it takes a while to make all those little naans.  Using fresh cilantro, ginger and chiles makes a BIG difference.

1.  In a small, ungreased skillet, dry-roast the cumin seeds over medium heat, stirring until they turn a shade darker.  Use a mortar and pestle, or a spice mill, to grind the seeds finely.

2.  In a bowl, combine the tomato sauce, ginger, heavy cream, garam masala, salt, green chile, cayenne, cilantro, lemon juice and roasted cumin seeds.  

3.  In a large skilet, melt the butter.  Add the ingredients from the mixing bowl to the hot butter, bring to a simmer and cook over medium heat for 1 minute.  

4.  Add the grilled Tandoori-Style chicken pieces, stirring once to coat and briefly rewarm them.

5.  Transfer the coated chicken to a warm serving platter and spoon additional sauce evenly over the top.  Garnish with cilantro sprigs and serve immediately.

name: Tandoori Chicken
directions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees

Place all the ingredients except the chicken into a bowl, making sure to mix well.  Coat the chicken with the mixture and then placing on a baking sheet that has been coated with non-stick spray.

Bake for 45-50 minutes or until the juices run clear.

name: Taco Seasoning
directions:
1.  Combine all of the ingredients in a small bowl.

In a large skillet, brown 1 pound ground beeg until crumbly; drain fat.  Add spices & seasonings and 2/3 cup of water; mix thoroughly.  Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat to low and cook, uncovered, 7 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.

name: Indian Naan
directions:
1.  Whisk the warm milk/water with the yeast and sugar until the yeast is dissolved.  Cover and let stand in a warm place for 10 minutes.

2.  Sift flour and salt three times into a large bowl add the yeast mixture, half of the ghee and the yogurt.  Mix into a soft dough then knead on a floured surface for about 5 minutes or until dough is smooth and elastic.  Place the dough in a large greased bowl, cover and let stand in a warm place for 1 1/2 hours or until the dough is doubled in size.

3.  Punch down dough then knead for 5 minutes.  Divide dough into 6 pieces.  Roll each piece out into 8 inch round naans.  

4.  Cover an oven tray with foil and grease the foil.  Brush tha naan with a little of the remaining ghee and sprinkle with some of the kalonji.  Cook naan one at a time under a very hot grill (450 degree convection roast) for about 2 minutes on each side or until puffed and just browned.

name: Garam Masala
directions: In a heavy-bottomed pan fry all the ingredients for 5 minutes over medium heat.  Remove from heat.  Grind all the roasted ingredients together to a powder.  Store in an airtight container.

name: Mango Lassi
directions: Blend all the ingredients in an electric blender.  Serve cold.

name: Shrimp Biryani
directions:
Soak rice in cold water for 20 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 300 degrees.

Grind the ginger, garlic, green chiles, garam masala, cashew nuts and coconut to make a paste.

Heat 3 tablespoons of ghee in a pan and add half of the onions and fry until golden brown.  Add the ground paste and stir fry for about 5 minutes.  Add the shrimp and 1/2 tsp salt.  Mix well untill all the shrimps are coated with masala and cook for 5 minutes over low heat.  Remove from heat and set aside.  Take another pan and heat 2 tbl ghee and fry the bay leaves and the rest of the onions and fry until the onions are golden brown.  Add the rice and stir fry until the rice becomes translucent (about 10 minutes).  Add the 1/2 tsp salt and 2 cups of water.  Cover the pan and cook over low heat for 15 minutes or until the rice is almost done.  

Mix the rice and shrimp together and transfer it to a casserole.  Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 10-15 minutes at 300 degrees.  Sprinkle with lime juice and garnish with fried cashews and raisins.

name: Creme Brulee
directions:
Preheat the oven to 300F.  In a heavy medium saucepan, combine the cream,  vanilla bean and salt.  Warm over moderate heat until the surface begins to shimmer, about 5 minutes.  In a large bowl, stir the egg yolks and sugar until blended.  Pour in the hot cream and stir gently to avoid forming air bubbles.  Strain the custard into a large measuring glass and skim off and surface air bubbles.  (Rinse the vanilla bean and reserve for future use.) Place 8 3/4-cup ramekins in a roasting pan.  Pour the custard into the ramekins, filling them up to the rim.  Place the roasting pan in the oven and pour in enough warm water to reach halfway up the sides of the ramekins.  Cover loosely with foil and bake for 1 1/4 hours, or until the custard is firm around the edges.  (It may still be wobbly in the center but it will firm up as it chills.) Remove the ramekins from the water bath and let cool. 
 
Cover and refrigerate until cold, at least 3 hours.  (The custards can be prepared to this point up to 2 days ahead.  If small pools of liquid develop on the surfaces, blot with a paper towel before proceeding.) Preheat the broiler or a salamander.  Set the ramekins on a baking sheet.  Sieve 1 tablespoon of brown sugar over the top of each custard in a thin layer.  Using a spatula or knife, spread the sugar evenly.  Broil the custards as close to the heat as possible until the sugar is caramelized, 30 seconds to 2 minutes; watch carefully.  Let cool and serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 4 hours.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Turkey Tetrazzini With Almonds
directions: In a saucepan, over medium heat, combine cornstarch, milk, water, bullion cubes, salt, garlic powder, and pepper.  Bring the mixture to a boil, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and stir in grated parmesan cheese, mushrooms, noodles and turkey.  Coat a 9" casserole dish with vegetable cooking spray.  Spoon the turkey mixture into the dish and top with sliced almonds and bread crumbs.  Bake at 375 degrees for 25 minutes or until the mixture bubbles and the top is browned. Cook the noodles before baking!!!!

name: Turkey Soup Continental
directions:
In a large kettle saute finely chopped onions in melted butter.  Add chopped turkey, diced potatoes, diced celery, and chicken broth.  Simmer until the vegetables are tender-crisp.  

Add corn, half and half, salt, paprika, ginger, pepper and chopped parsley.  Heat through, stirring occasionally
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Herb Butter Sauce
directions: Melt butter and olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat.  Saute garlic until fragrant, about 2 minutes.  Stir in parsely, basil, oregano, salt and pepper.  Simmer for 7 minutes, or until thoroughly heated.  Remove from heat and toss with pasta until evenly coated.  Serve immediately.

name: Old Fashioned Bread Pudding
directions:
Oven temp: 350 degrees
Baking time: 45 minutes
Place bread crumbs in a buttered baking dish (1 1/2 quart) and set aside.  Scald milk and butter.  In a large bowl combine sugar, eggs, salt, cinnamon, raisins.  Stir some of the milk into the egg mixture; gradually add the entire milk mixture to the eggs; stirring constantly.  Pour over the bread crumbs.  Bake in 350 degree oven until silver knife inserted one inch from edge comes out clean.

name: Garlic Cheese Green Beans
directions: In a large skillet melt margarine with olive oil; add garlic and cook until lightly browned, stirring frequently.  Stir in green beans and season with salt and pepper.  Cook until beans are tender, about 10 minutes.  Remove from heat and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

name: French Bread Rolls to Die For
directions: Put in bread machine.  Bake.

name: Saffron Rice
directions:
*Note - This makes a HUGE amount of rice.  Try making a half batch.

Place the saffron in a small bowl and cover with 3 tbl boiling water.  Soak for 10 minutes.  Meanwhile heat the butter over moderate heat in a large 3 or 4 quart stockpot.  Add the cinnamon and cloves and stir well.  Add onions and saute for about 5 minutes.  Add the rice and stir for about 5 minutes.  Pour in 4 cups of boiling water and salt.  Bring rice to a boil over high heat.  Add the saffron and its soaking water.  Stir gently.  Cover, reduce heat and cook for 25 minutes (never takes that long).  Fluff and serve hot.

name: Grilled Chicken with Orange-Cilantro Salsa
directions:
Combine oranges, cilantro, onion, olive oil, vinegar, jalapenos, reserved juice and salt in medium bowl.  Cover, refrigerate salsa for at least 2 hours.  

Grill or broil chicken until golden on outside and no longer pink in center.  Top each breast with salsa.  Great with rice.

name: Chantelle's Fudge
directions: Combine 1st four ingredients in pot.  Bring to a boil for five minutes, stirring constantly until soft ball stage.  Remove fron heat and stir in rest of ingredients until melted.  Pour into and 8x8 buttered pan.

name: Spanish Rice
directions: Heat oil in a medium saucepan.  Saute onion and green pepper until tender.  Add garlic and cook briefly.  Add rice and cook, stirring, until slightly toasty.  Meanwhile drain the tomatoes, reserving juice.  Chop tomatoes.  Add water to juice to make 2 cups.  Add liquid to pan, along with remainng ingredients.  Bring to a simmer, lower heat, cover and cook until rice is cooked and liquid is absorbed, about 20-25 minutes.

name: Tangy Sweet BBQ Sauce
directions: Chop onion. Saute in margarine until lightly colored.  Add all other ingredients and simmer for 30 minutes.  Makes 7 cups.

name: Bread Machine Bagels
directions:
Place ingredients in bread machine, use dough setting, when setting completed remove dough from pan (if not using a bread machine, knead dough for ~5 minutes and let rise in a warm place).

Place dough on lightly floured surface.  Punch and knead for 5-10 minutes until smooth.  Cut into 5 equal pieces.  From each piece form a ball and make a hole in each using your thumbs.  Stretch until smooth and hole is about 1 inch.  Place bagels on greased baking sheet and let rise covered for 10 minutes.  Heat oven to 400F, boil 6 cups of water in a large saucepan or skillet.  Cook bagels 2 at a time for 3 minutes, turning once.  Place bagels on greased sheet.  Brush with beaten egg and sprinkle with favorite toppings.  Bake at 400F for 20-25 minutes until deep golden brown.  Cool on a wire rack.

name: Cashew Rice
directions:
In a 2 quart baking dish, combine rice (uncooked), water, salt and margarine.  Cover dish with foil.  Bake at 350 degress for 45 minutes to 1 hour.  (45 minutes in our oven)
 
About 15 minutes before rice is done, saute in a saucepan over medium heat, carrots, onions, cashews and continue cooking for 5 minutes (Until things start to brown).  Just before serving, toss the vegetables with the rice.

name: Applebee's White Chocolate & Walnut Blondie - Cake
directions:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees.

To make the blondie cake whip the egg whites until they are stiff and form peaks.  Add softened butter, 1/2 cup packed brown sugar, 1/4 cup granulated sugar, and vanilla and mix with an electric mixer until smotth.  In a sepaprate bowl sift together flour, baking soda, baking powder and 1/4 tsp salt.  Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix well until smooth.  Mix in milk, white chocolate chunks, and walnuts.  Pour ingredients into a greased 9x13 inch baking pan and bake for 40-45 minutes or until cake is golden frown on top.  Slice cake into 8 equal slices when cool.

While cake bakes, make the sauce (Applebee's White Chocolate & Walnut Blondie - Sauce) 

To prepare dessert, heat a skillet in a hot oven for 10 to 15 minutes (you can also serve the dessert on a plate).  Arrange the cake on the skillet or plate.  Heat up the sauce for 30 to 60 seconds in the microwave until hot.  Place a scoop of vanilla ice cream on the cake, then drizzle some of the sauce over the top, followed by a tablespoon of chopped walnuts.  Serve immediately.

Credit: http://www.TopSecretRecipes.com
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Applebee's White Chocolate & Walnut Blondie Sauce
directions:
Combine all ingredients in a medium bowl with an electric mixer.

Credit: http://www.TopSecretRecipes.com
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Grilled Tenderloin with Garlic-Cilantro Butter
directions:
Cut tenderloins crosswise into 1-inch pieces, flatten slightly.  Combine the rest of the ingredients.  Marinate pork in mixture 4 hours, refrigerated.  Remove pork from marinade.  Panbroil in heavy skillet over medium-high heat 2-3 minutes per side.  

Garlic Cilantro Butter:  Process together 1/2 pound butter, 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, 2 tsp lime juice, 2 tbl roasted garlic.

Roasted Garlic:  Place garlic in a small roasting pan (small aluminum bread pan works great).  Cover garlic with olive oil.  Bake at 350 degrees until garlic is soft (30 minutes or less in our oven).

name: Wonton (Soup/Fried)
directions:
Put all ingredients in food processor and mix to mush... add a bit of cornstarch if mixture does not hold together.  Fill each wonton wrapper with a 1/2 tbl or so - fold and seal using a bit of water around the edges (ancient Chinese secret!).

For soup:
Add wontons to chicken stock at rolling boil.  Cook for 5 minutes.  Garnish with chopped green onion and serve.

To Fry:
Preheat 1/4" peanut oil in wok over medium heat.  Fry 4-6 wontons at a time for 2-3 minutes on each side or until lightly browned.  Drain on brown paper.  Yummy with Duck Sauce for dipping.

name: German Oven Pancakes
directions: Heat oven to 375 deg.  Mix all ingredients together.  Grease and flour a 9" glass pie plate.  Bake at 375 deg. for 25 min or until done.

name: Crepes
directions: Sift dry ingredients together in bowl.  Combine milk, butter and eggs in separate bowl and stir into dry mixture.  Mix with hand mixer or in blender until smooth.  Pour about 3 tbl at a time into heated, greased skillet - tilt pan quickly to cover bottom of pan.  Brown lightly and flip to brown on reverse.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Pizza Hut Pan Pizza
directions:
Mix yeast, sugar, salt, and dry milk in a large (2 qt.) bowl.  Add water and stir to mix well.  Allow to sit for two minutes.  Add oil and stir again.  Add flour and stir until dough forms and flour is absorbed.  Turn out on flat surface and kneed for 10 minutes.

  Divide dough into three balls.  Put 3 oz of oil in each of three 9" pie pans and allow to spread evenly over pan bottoms.  Roll each dough ball into a 9" circle and place in a pie pan.  Spray outer edge of each dough with Pam.  Cover with a plate and place each in a warm area to rise or 1 to 1 1/2 hours.

  Make sauce now (see "Pizza Hut Pizza Sauce")

  Preheat oven to 475 deg.  
  1.) Put 1/3 cup sauce on each dough and spread evenly to about 1" of edge.  
  2.) Spread 1 1/2 oz of mozzarella on each dough.
  3.) Place toppings in this order:
    a.) Pepperoni or Ham
    b.) Vegetables
    c.) Meats (cooked sausage or ground beef)
  4.) Top each with 3 oz more mozzarella.
  5.) Cook until cheese is bubbling and outer crust is brown.

name: Dill Chicken in Foil
directions:
Sprinkle chicken thighs with salt and pepper.  In small container, mix together melted margarine, lemon juice and dill weed.   Cut eight 12-inch squares of heavy duty aluminum foil; spray each with vegetable cooking spray.  Place 1 tsp of dill-margarine sauce on center of each foil square; place 1 chicken thigh on sauce.  On each chicken thigh, sprinkle 1 teaspoon green onion and 2 tbl carrot slices; top each with 1 additional teaspoon of the sauce and 1 slice of cheese.  Fold foil into packets, sealing securely.   Label, date and freeze chicken until needed.*  When ready to serve, put frozen foil packets in baking pan and place in 400 degree oven for about 1 hour or until fork can be inserted in chicken with ease. 

*If serving immediately without freezing, place foil packets in baking pan and bake in 400 degree oven for about 30 minutes or until fork can be inserted in chicken with ease.

name: Filet Mignon Texas Style
directions:
Mix all the ingredients, except the filet mignons and oil, together in a small bowl.

Generously season the filets by rubbing and patting all over with spice mix.  Let sit, lightly covered with waxed paper at room temperature for 1 hour. 

To cook, heat the oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium-high heat.  Fry the steaks 3 minutes per side for medium-rare. (Do not worry about the blackened crust.)  Serve immediately.

name: Filet Mignon with Rich Balsamic Glaze
directions:
1) Sprinkle freshly ground pepper over both sides of each filet and sprinkle with salt to taste.  

2) Heat a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hot.  Place filets in hot pan, and cook each side for 1 minute, covered, until browned.  Turn heat down to medium-low, add 1/4 cup balsamic vinegar and all of the red wine.  Cover, and continue to cook for 4 minutes each side, uncovering once to turn filets and spoon balsamic-wine glaze over filets. Add additional balsamic vinegar if needed.  

3) Remove filets to two warmed plates, spoon one tablespoon of glaze over each, and serve immediately.

name: Blueberry Streusal Muffins
directions:
Blend all streusal ingredients together and set aside.

Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt; set aside.  In mixing bowl, cream butter with sugar until fluffy.  Add egg, beat until smooth, then add vanilla.  To this creamed mix alternately add the flour mixture and the milk.  Blend completely, then fold in blueberries.  Fill 12 regular size greased muffin cups two-thirds full.  Sprinkle streusal over top of muffins.  Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes or when tested, the toothpick comes clean.  Cool 5 minutes, then remove from pan and cool completely on the rack.

name: Lawry's Taco Spices and Seasonings
directions:
1. Combine all of the ingredients in a small bowl.

2. In a large skillet, brown 1 pound ground beef until crumbly; drain fat.  Add spices and seasonings and 2/3 cup water; mix thoroughly.  Bring to a boil: reduce heat to low and cook, uncovered, 7 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.

name: Red Lobster Cheddar Biscuits
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 450 degrees.

2. Combine baking mix, 1 cup of the cheddar cheese, garlic, milk and 1 half of the melted butter in a medium bowl.  Mix by hand until well-combined.

3.  Form the biscuits and sprinkle remaining cheese and parsely over the tops.

name: Mexican Pizza
directions:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.  Start frying the shells while hamburger is cooking!!!

1.  In a medium bowl, combine the ground beef with the flour, chili powder, salt, dried onion, paprika, garlic powder and onion powder.  Use your hands to thoroughly incorporate everything into the ground beef.

2.  Preheat a skillet over medium heat, and add the ground beef mixture to the pan along with the water.  Brown the beef mixture for 5-6 minutes, using a wooden spoon or spatula to break up the meat as it cooks.

3.  Heat oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat.  If oil begins to smoke, it is too hot.  When oil is hot, fry each tortilla for about 30-45 seconds per side and set aside on brown paper bags.  When fryig each tortilla, be sure to pop any bubbles that form so that tortilla lays flat in oil.  Tortillas should become golden brown.  

4.  When meat and tortillas are done, stack each pizza by first spreading meat on the tortilla.  Place another tortilla on top and cover the surface with salsa.  Finally, top with monterey jack and cheddar cheese.

5.  Place pizzas in oven on cookie sheets and bake until cheese melts.

name: Pizza Hut Pizza Sauce
directions: Combine all ingredients and let sit for 1 hour.

name: Devilled Eggs
directions: Hard boil eggs.  Allow to completely cool.  Cut eggs in half longwise and remove the yolks, saving the yolks in a bowl.  Mix the egg yolks with the rest of the ingredients, using just enough vinegar or cream to moisten.  Place the mixture into each egg white.

name: Grilled Marinated Beef with Carmelized Onions
directions:
Mix marinade ingredients together in bowl.  Remove 1/4 of the marinade and save for basting.  Gently score steak, spread with marinade  and allow to stand 1-2 hours at room temperature or refrigerate if marinating longer.  Grill for 5 minutes each side before marinating.  Cook until done (smoking with wood chips works nicely!)

Carmelized Onions:
Heat olive oil and butter in heavy skillet until almost smoking.  Add onions and saute until translucent (10-15 minutes).  Add brown sugar and chicken stock and season with salt and pepper to taste.  Simmer until all liquid is absorbed.

Slice steak into 1/4 thick slices and top with onions.  Yum!

Onions go fast!  Make extra!

name: Chicken Marsala with Proscuitto
directions:
1. Melt butter over low heat in a medium saucepan.

2. Turn heat up to medium/high to saute the prosciutto in the melted butter for about 2-3 minutes (be careful not to burn the butter). Add shallots and garlic and saute for about 30 seconds.  Add marsala wine, simmer for another 30 seconds or so, then add mushrooms (drain off liquid from can first) and black pepper.  Simmer over medium/high heat for 5 minutes.

3. Dissolve corn starch in chicken stock.  Add stock to the saucepan and simmer for an additional 5 minutes.  

4.  Add parsley and cream to the sauce and simmer for 3 to 4 minutes or until thick.  Remove pan from heat, then cover until needed.

5.  Preheat barbecue grill on high heat.  Combine ingredients for chicken spice in a small bowl.  Use your thumb and fingers to crush the spices in the bowl to make a finer blend.  

6.  Brush each chicken breast with olive oil.  Sprinkle spice blend over both sides of each chicken breast and grill for 6 to 8 minutes per side, or until done.  

7.  Serve chicken with sauce.

Credit: http://www.TopSecretRecipes.com
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Pork Tenderloin with Molasses Sauce
directions:
In a plastic bowl combine sherry, molasses and soy sauce.  Pour over pork chops (I use tenderloins).  Cover, refrigerate 30 minutes.  Prepare grill. Drain pork chops, grill over medium-high heat 20 to 30 minutes, or until pork is no longer pink in center, turning once and brushing frequently with marinade.  Discard any remaining marinade.  Do not baste during last 5 minutes of grilling.  

I usually make a second batch of sauce for dipping.  Don't forget to boil the extra batch to remove the alcohol or it will taste bitter.

name: Fajita Seasoning
directions:
Mix together all ingredients - add 2-3 tbl to zip-loc bag with sliced chicken strips.  Let sit 15 minutes or so before cooking with onions, etc.

  If a bit of spice is desired, add a bit of red pepper to taste.

name: Hash Brown Potato Bundles
directions: Heat oven to 375 degrees.  Package a hash brown with a portion of the rest of the ingredients in a tin foil package.  Bake for 35 to 45 minutes.

name: Chicken Cordon Bleu
directions: Cut a slit down one side of the chicken and slice through center to create a cavity.  Mix ham, cheese, garlic, wine and pepper.  Spoon mixture into pockets and seal slit with string.  Coat breasts well with season flour, brush with beaten egg and oil, then roll in bread crumbs. Heat oil in frying pan.  Add butter and when butter is foaming, cokk chicken until tender, golden brown and crisp.

name: Oatmeal Raisin Cookies
directions:
Heat oven to 350 degrees.

Beat together butter and sugars until creamy.

Add eggs and vanilla; beat well.

Add comined flour, baking soda, cinnamon; mix well.

Stir in oats and raisins; mix well.

Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet.

Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown.

Cool 1 minute on cookie sheet; remove to wire rack.

name: Famous Milk Chocolate Fudge
directions:
1. LINE 8-inch-square baking pan with foil. 

2. COMBINE sugar, evaporated milk, butter and salt in medium, heavy-duty saucepan. Bring to a full-rolling boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Boil, stirring constantly, for 4 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat. 

3. STIR in marshmallows, morsels, nuts and vanilla extract. Stir vigorously for 1 minute or until marshmallows are completely melted. Pour into prepared pan; refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm. Lift from pan; remove foil. Cut into pieces. 

Makes 49 pieces.

Cooking Tip: For thicker fudge, use a 9 x 5-inch loaf pan; refrigerate for 3 hours.

name: Olive Garden Chocolate Lasagna
directions:
Make the cake in a 13x9-inch pan according to the directions on the box (Preheat oven to 350 degrees, mix cake mix, water, oil, and eggs in large bowl; pour batter into pan greased generously with shortning).  Allow cake to cool completely.

When cake is completely cool, make buttercream frosting by first whipping the soft butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer on high speed.  Add two cups of powdered sugar.  Mix well.  Add remaining powered sugar and 1/4 whole milk and vanilla.  Mix on high speed for two minutes until frosting is smooth and creamy.

Turn cake onto wax paper.  Turn again onto another piece of wax paper so cake is right-side-up.  We will be cutting the cake into three equal layers.  First cut the bottom third of the cake.  Moving it to the edge of the counter and turning the cake as it's cut makes this easier.  Take the top piece (2/3 of the cake) and turn it over onto another sheet of wax paper.  Frost the bottom piece with 1/3 of the frosting and sprinkle with 1/3 of the semi-sweet chocolate, broken into small peices.  Flip the top 2/3 of the cake that was removed back onto the frosted layer.  Cut this top layer in half and flip the top 1/3 off to the side as you did before (I found it easier to cut the top layer into thirds to make it easier to flip (since it's so thin... also these will be the lines the cake is cut along in the end so the cuts will not be visible).  Again ice the top of the cake and sprinkle with chocolate as before.  Replace the top 1/3 of the cake and ice with remaining frosting and sprinkle with remaining chocolate.  

Cut entire cake lenghwise into 3 equal peices widthwise and then cut two times along the length (you should now have 6 equal, rectangular pieces).  Finally, cut each rectangular piece from corner to corner to form 12 triangular pieces.

Chill or freeze unused portions.

Credit: http://www.TopSecretRecipes.com
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Boneless Buffalo Wings
directions:
Combine flour, salt, peppers, and paprika in medium bowl.  In small bowl, whisk together milk and eggs.

Slice each chicken breast into six pieces.  Preheat oil to 375 degrees.

One or two at a time, dip the chicken pieces in the egg mixture and then the flour mixture and repeat (coat each piece two times).

Once all chicken is double breaded, chill for 15 minutes.

Fry each piece in hot oil for 5-6 minutes or until each piece is browned.

Heat hot sauce and margarine in microwave or small saucepan and sprinkle over chicken or use to dip chicken in.

name: Chicken Francese
directions:
Place the chicken breasts between sheets of waxed paper and pound with the smooth side of a mallet until they're thin.  Cut the chicken breasts into strips.

Place cheese and 2 tbl parsley in a wide, shallow bowl.  Slowly add the beaten egg, whisking until it's smoothly incorporated.  Place the flour on a wide plate, mix in salt and pepper to taste to the flour.

Dip the pounded chicken slices in the egg mixture.  Remove, letting excess egg drip back into the bowl.  Place each cutlet in the flour, and coat lightly.  Remove from flour and hold them in a single layer.

Add the olive oil to a saute pan large enough to hold the cutlets in a single layer (you might have to do two batches).   Place over medium-high heat.  When the oil is hot, add the cutlets.  Saute, turning once, until the cutlets are golden on the outside, just cooked on the inside (about 2 minutes per side).

Remove the cutlets, and hold them in a single layer.

Drain the oil out of the saute pan.  Return the pan to high heat.  Add the white wine, and reduce it to 6 tablespoons.  Add the chicken stock and the lemon slices.  Boil for 5 minutes, then remove the lemon slices.  Keep boiling the sauce until it's reduced to 1 and a half cups.  

Turn heat to very low.  Swirl in the butter until the sauce is thickened.  If the sauce does not thicken, add small amounts of gravy flour until it does.  You might also add some corn starch for even thicker sauce.  Add the cooked chicken pieces, turning them until they are coated in sauce.  Divide cutlets among 2 plates, pour remaining sauce over them, sprinkle with remaining 2 tablespoons of parsley and serve immediately.

name: Pie Crust for Pot Pie
directions:
Mix ingredients together.  Makes 2 double and 1 single crust pie or approx. 8 pot pies (double crusted)

Use Progresso  Rich & Hearty "Pot Pie" style chicken soup or beef stew.  Cook at 425-450 until crust is browned.

name: Corn Dogs
directions:
Mix ingredients together and adjust with milk flour to make thick if necessary.   Fill a tall glass with mixture and dip in dogs on sticks and drop into 370 deg oil until browned. 

Needs a bit more cornmeal I think.

name: Playdough - KoolAid
directions: Mix all dry ingredients together.  Add water and oil and stir.  Knead with hands when mixture is cool.  Store in air-tight container.  This recipe lasts for several months.

name: Chicken in Orange-Cashew Sauce
directions:
Wash chicken in cold water; pat dry with paper towels.
Heat butter in large skillet.  Brown chicken lightly, remove.
Mix flour, remaining salt, cinnamon and ginger.  Blend into pan drippings to make a smooth paste (sometimes you have to add a little butter if there aren't enough drippings from the chicken).
Add orange juice; cook, stirring constantly until sauce bubbles and thickens.  Return chicken to skillet along with cashew and raisins.  
Cover; cook over low heat about 45 minutes, or until chicken is fork tender.
Serve chicken and sme of sauce on a bed of rice, pass remaining sauce.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Chicken Piccata
directions:
Put chicken breasts between 2 sheets of waxes paper or plastic wrap;  pound to flatten to about 1/4 inch.  In a shallow bowl, combine flour, salt, pepper and paprika.  Brush some olive oil on the chicken and dredge chicken breasts in flour mixture to coat well.  

Heat butter and olive oil in a large skillet.  Saute chicken breasts in batches, about 3 minutes on each side.

Drain off all but 2 tbl of fat.  Stir in chicken broth, scraping to loosen browned bits.  Add lemon juice and heat through.  Return chicken to the skillet the lemon slices; heat until sauce thickens.  Serve with your favorite pasta.

name: Sweet and Sour Pork/Chicken
directions:
Pound pork or chicken with back of clever to tenderize.  Cut into 1" cubes.  Mix with "A" and marinade for 30 minutes or overnight.  Cut peppers into 1" squares (remove seeds and membranes).  Peel carrots and slice diagonally into 1/8" thick slices.  Peel onion and cut into 1" squares.  Drain pineapple.  Set each aside separately. 

  Mix "C" together in a bowl and set aside.  Heat 4-6 cups oil in deep skillet or wok.  

  Dredge each piece of meat in corn starch to coat and then fry in oil until golden brown (about 4 minutes).  Drain and set aside.

  In separate wok or pan, heat 2 tbl oil up until hot.  Add carrot and cook for 1 minute.  Add onions and cook for 2 more minutes.  Add green peppers and  cook for 1 more minute.  Add pineapple and cook for 1 last minute (5 minutes total).  Pour in mixture "C" and cook until thickened.  Turn off heat.  Add meat, stir.

Serve immediately over rice.

name: Wonderful Waffles
directions: Put eggs, milk, and oil in blender.  Mix slightly.  Add flour and rest of ingredients while mixing.  Cook on hot waffle iron.

name: Contra Costa Flank Steak
directions: Combine bread crumbs, cheese, parsley, salt, and pepper and mix well.  Combine beaten eggs with milk.  Tenderize flank steak and cut into serving size pieces.  Dip each piece in egg mixture and then bread crumb mixture; repeat until all eggs and crumbs are used.  Cook garlic in oil.  Brown meat slowly in seasoned oil.  When meat is well browned, lower heat and add wine.  Cover and simmer 10 minutes.

name: BBQ Spiced Tenderloin Steak
directions:
Combine ingredients in a bowl (can be stored 1 week in an airtight container.  Why not longer?)
Heat grill to high.  Rub both sides of each steak with mixture to coat well.
Grill (about 3 minutes on each side for medium-rare).
Serve hot.

Yum.

name: Crabcakes
directions:
Melt the butter over low heat.  Add flour by single tablespoons, mixing well with each addition.  Slowly add the evaporated milk, stirring constantly.  This should be a smooth thick white sauce.  Continue stirring over very low heat and add seasonings.  

Shape into patties.  Dip in bread crumbs, then in egg, then in bread crumbs again.  Bake for 40 minutes at 325 degrees until golden on top.  Or you can pan fry them.

name: Butterball Sweet Basil Rub
directions: Rub on turkey, roast per label directions

name: Pecan Tassies
directions:
1) Preheat oven to 350 degrees.  In small bowl, with mixer at high speed, beat cream cheese with 7 tbl butter until creamy.  Reduce speed to low add flour and beat until well mixed.

2) With floured hands, divide dough into 24 equal pieces (dough will be very soft).  With floured fingertips, gently press dough pieces evenly onto bottoms & up sides of twenty-four 1 3/4" by 3/4" ungreased miniature muffin pan cups.

3) In medium bowl, with wire whisk or fork, mix brown sugar, vanilla, salt, egg and remaining 1 tbl butter until filling is blended.

4) Place half of pecans in pastry-lined cups.  Spoon filling by heaping tsp into each pastry cup; sprinkle tops with remaining pecans.

5) Bake 30 minutes or until filling is set and edges of crust are holden.  With tip of knife, gently loosen tassies from muffin pan cups and place on wire rack to cool completely.  Store tassies in tightly covered container up to 1 week.

name: Au Gratin Potatoes
directions:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.  Butter a 1 quart casserole dish.

Slice potatoes into 1/4 inch slices.  Slice onions into rings.

Layer 1/2 of the potatoes into bottom of the casserole dish.  Top with the onion slices, and add the remaining potatoes.  Season with salt and pepper.  

In a medium-size saucepan, melt butter over medium heat.  Mix in the flour and salt, and stir constantly with a whisk for one minute.  Stir in milk.  cook until mixture has thickened.  Stir in cheese all at once, and continue stirring until melted, about 30 to 60 seconds.  Pour cheese over the potatoes, and cover the dish with aluminum foil.

Bake 1 - 1/2 hours in oven.

name: Turkey Injection Marinade
directions:
Put ingredients into a quart jar and mix.

Place lid on jar and shake well.  Make sure all the garlic salt is dissolved.

Inject 2/3 of the recipe in the turkey the night before to fry the next day.  Thirty minutes before frying inject the last 1/3.

name: Pizza Sauce - Easy
directions: Mix together the tomato paste, water, and olive oil.  Mix well.  Add garlic, pepper, oregano, basil and rosemary.  Mix well and let stand several hours to let flavors blend.  No cooking necessary, just spread on dough.

name: Rice Balls - Italian Style (Arancini)
directions:
Cook rice following directions, but omit butter.  Cool until easy to handle.  

Fold in slightly beaten egg yolks and grated cheese.  Mix well.

Shape balls using a little more than 1/4 cup each, placing a cube of mozzarella in the center of each (moisten hands for easier shaping).

Beat egg whites in one pie plate, place bread crumbs in another.  Gently roll rice balls in egg white and then in bread crumbs.  Place in flat pan and chill for one hour.  

Heat vegetable oil and fry balls, turning for even cooking - cook until golden.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Cutlets with Balsamic Vinegar
directions:
1. Spread bread crumbs on wax paper and press both sides of each cutlet into the crumbs.
2. Heat skillet on medium-high heat.  Add a little oil and cook cutlets on each side until they are lightly browned.  Add a little extra oil after turning.
3. Set meat aside on a plate.
4. Stir butter, garlic, and sage into skillet until aroma fills kitchen (pretty quick).
5. Add chicken broth and brown sugar.
6. Simmer down to about 1/3 cup.
7. Add balsamic vinegar and simmer 1 minute more.
8 Pour some sauce over each cutlet and serve.

Particularly good with parmesan & butter rice.  Yum.

name: IHOP Pancakes
directions: Mix ingredients in blender and cook over medium heat until golden brown.

name: Yaki Soft Tacos
directions:
Buy a 20 ounce can of pineapple tidbits to make the sauce and tacos.

1) Cut chicken into fairly small pieces.  Make teriyaki sauce (see other recipe)

2) Keep 1 cup of teriyaki sauce aside to put on tacos and use the rest (cooled) to marinade the chicken overnight.

3) When chicken has marinated, preheat a large skillet over medium/low heat.  Wipe the pan with a little oil.  Remove the chicken from the marinade (toss out the marinade) and saute chicken in the pan for 8 to 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and browned on both sides.  Microwave the 1 cup of saved teriyaki sauce in the oven for 30 to 60 seconds or until it's hot.  

4) When the chicken is done, preheat another skillet over medium heat.  Toss a tortilla into the pan for minute, then flip it over and add 2 to 3 tablespoons of shredded cheese across the center of the tortilla.  Let the tortilla sit in the pan for about a minute or so (until the cheese starts melting) then remove the tortilla and immediately spoon the equivalent of one chicken tender into the tortilla (3 or 4 bowl over the chicken).  Spoon about 1-1/2 tablespoons of leftover teriyaki sauce over the chicken in each taco.

5) Arrange about 1/3 cup shredded lettuce over the chicken in each taco.  Follow that up with 1 to 2 tablespoons of pineapple chunks, 1 to 2 tablespoons diced tomato, and a couple pinches of chopped green onion.

name: Teriyaki Sauce
directions: Whisk the cornstarch into the water in a medium saucepan.  Add remaining ingredients, then bring mixture to a boil.  Reduce heat and simmer for 7 to 10 minutes or until thicker.

name: Crispy Crepes
directions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.  Toast pecans in a shallow baking pan in middle of oven, shaking occassionally, until fragrant and a few shades darker, 8 to 10 minutes.  Toss immediately with 1/2 tbl butter and 1/8 tsp salt.

Melt remaining 3 tbl butter in a well seasoned crepe pan or an 8 inch nonstick skillet.  Blend milk, eggs, flour, remaining 1/4 tsp salt and 2 tbl sugar in a blender until smooth.  Pour in melted butter, leaving a film of butter in skillet, and blend until well combined.

Heat skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking.  Half fill a 1/4 cup measure with batter and, holding skillet off heat, pour in batter, immediately swirling and tilting skillet to create a thin even layer.  (If batter sets before skillet is coated, reduce heat slightly.  Next crepe will be better.)  Return skillet to heat and cook until crepe is golden around edges and dry in center, about 45 seconds.  Flip crepe carefully and cook until golden, about 15 seconds more.  Sprinkle crepe lightly with sugar.

Make more crepes with remaining batter, stacking them as cooked and lightly sprinkling each with sugar.  

Preheat broiler and butter an 8-inch round shallow baking dish.

Heat dulce de leche paste and cream in a small saucepan over moderate heat, stirring, until smooth.  Reduce heat and simmer until slightly thickened, about 1 minute.

Fold crepes into eighths and arrange in baking dish.  Sprinkle lightly with sugar, then broil about 6 inches from heat until edges are cripsy, about 45 seconds.  Serve with sauce and pecans.

name: Dulce de Leche
directions:
1.  Empty the sweetened condensed milk into a large microwave safe bowl.

2.  Microwave on medium power for two minutes and stir with a wire whisk.

3.  Microwave on medium power for another two minutes and stir.

4.  Return to the microwave for 16 to 24 minutes on medium-low power or until milk turns thick and caramel color, stirring every few minutes.

name: Puffed Apple Pancake
directions:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees.  

Whisk milk, eggs, sugar, vanilla, salt, cinnamon and nutmeg in large bowl until well blended.  Add flour and whisk until batter is smooth.  Place butter in 13x9 inch glass baking dish.  Place dish in oven until butter melts about 5 minutes.  

Remove dish from oven.  Place apple slices in overlapping rows atop melted butter in baking dish.  Return to oven and bake until apples begin to soften slightly and butter is bubbling and beginning to brown around edges of dish, about 10 minutes.  

Pour batter over apples in dish and sprinkle with brown sugar.  Bake pancake until puffed and brown, about 20 minutes.  Sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired.  Serve warm.

name: Coq Au Vin (Chicken with wine)
directions:
Remove fat from chicken and cut breasts into large chunks.  

In a large skillet cook bacon.  Remove bacon but leave drippings in the pan.  Mix flour, salt and pepper.  Coat chicken pieces with flour mixture.  Brown chicken in bacon drippings. Push chicken off to one side.  Add carrots, onions and garlic.  Cook and stir until onions are tender.  Drain off fat.  Crumble bacon and add to the pan along with the broth, wine, thyme, bay leaf and parsely.  

Bring to a boil, then lower heat and simmer for 45 minutes or until chicken is tender.

Remove chicken, onions and carrots from the sauce.  Thicken sauce by stirring in 1 to 2 tablespoons flour and simmering a few minutes.  Serve with the sauce spooned over the chicken.

name: Country Captains Chicken
directions:
Cook rice per directions on bag.

Trim fat off chicken and cut into large chunks.  Season chicken with black pepper.  Combine flour and paprika in a shallow dish.  Coat chicken pieces in paprika seasoned flour - make sure to work the seasoning well into the chicken.  

Heat a large skillet over medium high heat.  Add olive oil to the pan.  Brown chicken pieces, 3 minutes on each side, and remove from the skillet.  Add butter to the pan, then stir in peppers, onions and garlic.  Season the veggies with black pepper and saute them 5 to 7 minutes to soften.

Add curry, chicken stock, tomato sauce and raisins.  Slide chicken back into the skillet and simmer over moderate heat, covered, for 5 minutes to combine flavors and finish cooking the chicken through.  Place chicken with sauce in a serving dish and garnish with almonds.  Place rice in a serving dish and garnish with scallions.

name: Pizza Dough
directions: Mix dry ingredients in bowl first, then add water.  Mixture may appear too dry, keep kneeding, do not add water.  Kneed until smooth.  Set aside to rise for 1 hour.  Punch down and knead again.  Freeze at this point if desired.  At this point (or after thawing frozen), let rise for 1 hour again.  Punch down one last time and use.

name: Chicken with Feta Cheese And Bacon
directions:
Combine olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, salt and pepper in a small bowl and set aside.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees.  Mix feta and ricotta cheese and crumbled bacon in a small bowl.  Stuff chicken breasts with cheese mixture.  Secure open sides with toothpicks.  

Place chicken breasts in a baking pan and pour oil mixture over chicken.  Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes.

name: Hooter's Wings
directions:
-In a shallow dish, combine flour, salt, red pepper, and paprika.
-Coat chicken in the flour mixture; refrigerate coated wings for 1 hour; coat chicken again with remaining flour mixture.
-In a 2-quart saucepan, heat butter, hot sauce, pepper, and garlic powder just until butter melts; turn heat to low and keep warm on stove top.
-Deep-fry chicken, 8 - 10 pieces at a time, in 375 degree oil for 13 minutes.
-Drain chicken on brown paper bags.
-Immediately toss fried chicken in buffalo sauce mixture and remove with a slotted spoon.
-Repeat with remaining chicken.

Adjusting the spiciness of the sauce: As is, the recipe produces a medium sauce. To change the amount of spiciness, simply adjust the butter-to-hot sauce ratio:
Mild: Use 3/4 cup butter and 1/4 cup hot sauce.
Hot: Use 1/4 cup butter and 3/4 cup hot sauce.

Notes: Use ranch or blue cheese dressing  as a dip for these fabulous wings.

name: Hawaiian Skillet Chicken
directions:
1.  If the chicken breasts are thick, slice them in half longwise so that they are fairly thin.  Place flour, salt and pepper in a ziploc bag.  Place chicken pieces in bag one at a time and shake until covered with flour mixture.

2.  In a large, heavy skillet, heat oil over medium heat.  Once the oil is hot, add the chicken pieces to the skillet.  Saute until nicely brown and cooked through.  Transfer chicken to a plate and remove the skillet from the heat.

3.  Add the pineapple with the juice, brown sugar, soy sauce, ginger, cloves and paprika.  Return the skillet to medium heat and stir for a minute.  Add the tablespoon of flour and continue to heat the sauce, stirring to collect any remaining juices and brown bits from pan, and allowing it to thicken slightly (about 2 minutes).  Pour the sauce over the chicken and serve with white rice.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Brown Sugar Glazed Carrots
directions:
Cut carrots into 1/4 inch thick slices.  Heat 1 inch water to boiling in the saucepan over high heat.  Add the carrot slices.  Cover and heat to boiling again.  Reduce heat just enough so water bubbles gently.  Cook covered 12 to 15 minutes or until carrots are tender when pierced with a fork.  While carrots are cooking, heat the brown sugar, margarine, and orange peel in the skillet over medium heat, stirring constantly, until sugar is dissolved and mixture is bubbly.  Be careful not to overcook or the mixture will taste scorched.  Remove the skillet from the heat.  

Drain carrots in a strainer, then stir them into the brown sugar mixture.  Cook over low heat about 5 minutes, stirring occassionally and gently, until carrots are glazed and hot. 

*note* The brown sugar will not dissolve, just wait until the butter is melted and things are combined.  Pretty much once you have bubbles you are good.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: German Oven Pancakes - Better
directions:
1.  Preheat oven to 475 degrees (NOT CONVECTION)

2.  In a medium bowl, beat eggs with an electric mixer.  Mix in milk, cream, sugar, salt, and vanilla.  Mix until sugar is dissolved.  Sift in flour (and yes, you should do that) and mix until smooth.  Let batter rest for about 10 minutes.

3.  Coat the bottom of a 9 or 10 inch oven-safe skillet (cast iron is best) with melted butter.  Pour batter into the pan, and bake for 14 to 16 minutes or until golden brown on top and dark brown around the edges.  Pancake will rise substantially while cooking.  Remove the pancake from the oven and let it sit for about a minute.  Loosen the pancake around the edge with a spatula, then slide it out of the pan onto a plate.  Dust with powdered sugar and serve with lemon wedges, butter and syrup on the side.

name: Honey Mustard Dressing
directions: Mix together

name: Potstickers Dipping Sauce
directions: Combine all together and store in a sealed container

name: Turkey Tetrazzinni
directions:
Make sauce: Melt butter in saucepan.  Stir in flour, salt, nutmeg and cayenne pepper until smooth.  Slowly stir in milk and chicken broth; bring to a boil, stirring constantly.  Boil gently for 2 minutes or until slightly thickened.

  Beat egg yolks with cream in small bowl.  Gently beat in a little of the hot mixture.  Return to saucepan and cook over low heat until hot - do not boil.  Remove from heat and stir in sherry.

Cook spaghetti per package directions and drain.  Add 2 cups of sauce to drained spaghetti and toss until well blended.  Add turkey to remaining sauce and blend well.

  Spread spaghetti in 12x8x2 baking dish.  Spoon turkey mixture over the top.  Sprinkle with cheddar cheese then cover the top with Parmesan cheese.

  Cover and bake in preheated 300 degree oven for 25 minutes; uncover and add breadcrumbs and bake for another 10-15 minutes until browned.

name: Cream Currant Scones
directions:
Preheat oven to 425 

Whisk together flour, baking powder, salt and sugar in a lage bowl (or 6 1-second pulses in a food processor). 
Cut in the butter (or 12 1-second pulses in a food processor) 
Add currents and mix quickly (1 second pulse in food processor) 
Transfer to large bowl, add cream and stir about 30 seconds, then knead for about 10 seconds into a sticky ball 
Press dough into a greased 8 in round cake pan and then flip over onto parchment paper. Cut the dough into 8 wedges (like a pizza) 
Put wedges on parchment paper on a cookie sheet, and bake 12-15 minutes, until tops are golden brown.  Cool for 10 minutes and serve.
author: Val Nicotina

name: Chicken Fingers - Ultimate
directions:
Preheat oven to 450 degrees.  Line cookie sheet with foil, spray with cooking spray.  In 1-gallon ziploc bag mix Bisquick, cheese, salt and paprika.

Cut chicken into 1/2 inch strips.  Dip half the chicken strips into egg; place in bag of Bisquick mixture.  Seal bag and shake to coat.  Place chicken on cookie sheet.  Repeat to use up remaining chicken.  Drizzle butter over chicken.

Bake 12-14 minutes, turning halfway through bake time with pancake turner, until no longer pink in center.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies - Best Recipe
directions:
1. Adjust oven racks to middle position and preheat oven to 375 degrees.

2. Whisk flour, salt, and baking soda together in small bowl; set aside

3. Cream together butter and sugars until light and fluffy (about 3 minutes with electric mixer at medium speed).

4. Add eggs, vanilla, and water to sugar mixture.  Beat until combined, about 40 seconds.

5. Add dry ingredients and beat at low speed until just combined, 20 seconds.

6. Stir in nuts and chocolate chips.

7. Drop by tablespoons onto cookie sheet lined with parchment paper.

8. Bake, reversing the position of the cookie sheet halfway thorugh baking (from top to bottom and front to back), until cookies are light golden brown and edges begin to crisp, 8-10 minutes.

9. Cool on sheets for 2 minutes beofre transfering to cooling racks with spatula.
author: Val Nicotina

name: McDonald's Biscuits
directions:
Stir together flour, powdered milk, sugar, baking powder, salt and cream of tarter in medium bowl.
Cut shortening into dry mixture until blended thoroughly.
Stir in buttermilk and 2 tbl melted margarine until well blended.
Knead on floured surface 1 minute or until elastic.
Roll out dough to 1/2" - 3/4" thick (better a little thicker).  Cut out circles with a wide glass.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 450 deg for 10-12 minutes until golden brown.
Brush while hot with remaining melted margarine.
author: Chris Higgins

name: BBQ Sauce (good for brisket)
directions: Heat oil in saucepan over medium heat.  Add onion and garlic; cook and stir until onion is tender.  Add remaining ingredients and simmer over medium heat for 5 minutes.  Yum.
author: Chris Higgins

name: Italian Meatballs
directions:
Mix all above ingredients by hand.  Make small meat balls and brown well.

Credit to Aunt Theresa for this recipe.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Chicago Deep Dish Pizza
directions:
Note: I usually halve this recipe and use two 9" metal pie plates.

 Add tepid water to mixing bowl and stir in yeast.  Add vegetable oil, 4 tbl olive oil, cornmeal, and 3 cups of flour.  Mix until well blended.  Slowly mix in the rest of the flour and knead for 10-15 minutes.  Allow dough to rise until doubled, punch down and then let rise until double again.
  Preheat oven to 425F.
  Oil pans with a bit of olive oil.  Divide the dough between the two pans and press to cover the bottom and up the sides.  Dough should be about 1/8 inch thick.
  Layer bottom of pies with mozzarella.  Cover cheese with tomatoes, sprinkle on basil, oregano, and garlic.  Add salt ot taste.  Add any additional toppings (sausage, pepperoni, olives, etc.).  Liberally sprinkle with grated Pamesan and drizzle remaining olive oil over pies.
  Bake at 475F for 35 to 40 minutes until top is golden and gooey and crust is light golden brown.
author: Chris Higgins

name: Cheesy Herbed Eggs
directions:
Place eggs in a large bowl and beat until uniform.  Add in cream, lemon, basil, oregano and rosemary and mix well.  Add in cheeses and mix.

Melt butter in a large skillet.  Cook and stir gently over medium heat until eggs are done.

Makes enough for 4 people, three if they are really hungry.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Indian scrambled eggs
directions: mix up eggs, then add uncooked onion, tomato and cilantro.  Stir together and pour into heated frying pan.  Add pepper as desired.  Onions should still be crunchy when done.
author: Val Nicotina

name: Pancakes - Very Yummy
directions:
Preheat skillet.  Pancakes work best on a hot skillet.  

Mix all ingredients in a blender until smooth.  Real buttermilk will work much better than the milk and lemon juice substitute that you can sometimes get away with, you need the thicker texture of the real buttermilk.

Put some non-stick spray in the pan and cook like a pancake.

Makes 8 to 10 pancakes.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Indian Corn Spice Rub
directions:
Heat a BBQ grill to 300 degrees or so.  Put the cobs on the grill and let cook for 20 minutes or so.  In our class they took the husks off for a drier corn texture.  I have seen several suggestions that you leave the husks on for a moister texture.  We haven't tried that yet.

Mix all dry ingredients in a small bowl.  Cut the lemon in half.  Dip the lemon in the mixture and rub it on the corn.  Note that this rub is very strong, so don't rub too much on, it just takes a bit.

The original recipe from our class called for a full teaspoon of salt and 1/2 tsp of chili powder.  We found this to be a bit too strong, but this recipe is so simple you can play with it to get what you want.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Mango Lassi - From class
directions:
I use Dannon Natural Vanilla Yogurt personally and I like the texture and flavor it gives.

In a blender put mangoes and yogurt (1 cup at a time) and mix until smooth.  Pour into individual cups and garnish with crushed pistachios.  This made enough for 5 people, so it's a pretty big batch and it maxed out my blender.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Tandoori Chicken - from class
directions:
Tie the yogurt in a muslin cloth (cheese cloth) or pour into a coffee filter and place it over a sieve to drain the excess water.  With Dannon Natural Vanilla yogurt this took about a half an hour to 45 minutes.  The teacher said it would take about 15 minutes, but maybe her yogurt was drier.

Make 2-3 quarter inch deep cuts in all the chicken pieces.  Mix 1 tsp chili powder, salt and 2 tbl lemon juice in a small bowl.  Apply this mixture to the chicken pieces and leave it for half an hour. 

In a deep bowl mix the yogurt with the rest of the chili powder, ginger paste, garlic paste, garam masala, food coloring and mustard oil.  Add the chicken to the marinade and coat well with mixture.  Refrigerate for 3-4 hours.

Heat a BBQ grill to a moderate temperature (400 degrees or so) and cook the chicken for 10-12 minutes.  Baste the chicken with butter and cook for an additional 5 mintues.  Garnish the chicken with sprinkles of chaat masala.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Mommy's Chicken and Potato Feast
directions:
Sammy and I invented this in the kitchen using the bits and pieces of a few different recipes, but mostly just our own ideas.  Since this was our own concoction I told Sammy that it needed a name and she came up with "Mommy's Chicken and Potato Feast".  It seemed appropriate, everyone had at least three helpings, including Sammy.

Wash the potatoes and cut them into fourths.  Put them in an 8 or 9 inch square casserole dish with the 1 tbl butter, basil and oregano and cook them on high in the microwave until done.  This took about 10 minutes in our overachieving microwave.  Make sure you stop it and stir the potatoes around a few times so that they cook evenly.

While the potatoes are cooking cut the chicken into fairly large long chunks.  Heat up the pan with 1 tbl butter (might need 2 depending on your pan).  Cook the chicken in the pan until cooked through and nicely browned.  

While the potatoes and chicken are cooking you need to make the sauce.  Add the wine, lemon juice and garlic to a small pot and reduce for 3 minutes.  Add the cream and sage and cook for another 2 minutes or until bubbling again.  Finally, add the butter and whisk until it is all combined.

When the chicken and potatoes have finished cooking, add the chicken to the casserole dish.  Pour the sauce over the chicken and potatoes and serve.  

I am thinking that if you had the time it would be nice to just brown the chicken and partly cook the potatoes and then put them together and let them cook in the sauce for a while in the oven.  I haven't tried that yet, if someone does, let me know how it comes out :-)
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Marinated Pepper-crusted Beef Tenderloin
directions:
Combine port, soy sauce, oil, 1 ½ teaspoons pepper, thyme, hot pepper sauce, garlic and bay leaf in bowl and mix well. 

Place beef in large, shallow dish. Pour wine mixture over beef. Marinate, tightly covered and refrigerated, 8 to 10 hours and up to 24, turning occasionally. Drain beef, reserving marinade. Bring marinade to boil in saucepan. Boil 3 minutes and remove from heat. Discard bay leaf. 

Preheat oven to 425 F. Coat beef with coarsely ground pepper. Place beef on rack in roasting pan. Insert a meat thermometer into beef. Bake 45 to 60 minutes, or until meat thermometer registers 140 F for medium rare or 150 F for medium, brushing frequently with warm reserved marinade. Makes 12 servings. 

PER SERVING: Calories 404 (48% fat) Fat 21 g (8 g sat) Cholesterol 142 mg Sodium 535 mg Trace fiber Carbohydrates 2 g Protein 47 g
author: Chris Higgins

name: Paint - Puffy
directions:
1.  Mix together the salt, flour, and water; the mixture should be about the consistency of pudding.

2. Add food coloring until the desired shade is reached, then use a funnel to transfer the paint to a squeeze bottle.  You can also tranfer the paints to a ziplock bag, then snip off one tiny corner of the bag for a make-it-yourself applicator.

This makes a puffy paint that glitters when dry.  It works much better on heavier paper like card stock or poster paper.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Pizza Dough - 2
directions:
Whisk together yeast, 1 tbl flour and 1/4 cup warm water in a measring cup and let stand until mixture develops a creamy foam, about 10 minutes. (If mixture doesn't foam, discard and start over with new yeast).

Stir together salt and 1 1/2 cups flour in a large bowl.  Add yeast mixture and remaining 3/4 cup warm water and stir until smooth, then stir in another 1/2 cup flour.  If dough sticks to your fingers, stin just enough flour (up to 3/4 cup) a little at a time, to make dough just come away from side of bowl.  This dough may be wetter than other pizza doughs you have made.  

Knead dough on a lightly floured surface with floured hands, lightly reflouring work surface and your hands when dough becomes too sticky, until dough is smotth, soft, and elastic, about 10 minutes.  Divide dough in half and form into 2 balls, then generously dust balls all over with flour and put each in a medium bowl.  Cover bowls with plastic wrap and let dough rise in a warm, draft-free place until doubled in bulk, 1 to 1 1/4 hours.

Makes two 10 inch pizzas.  I like to add some oregano and basil to the dough when you are doing the first mix to add some flavor.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Auntie Anne's Pretzels
directions:
1. Dissolve the yeast in the warm water in a small bowl or cup.  Let it sit for a few minutes.
2. Combine the flour, powdered sugar and salt in a large mixing bowl.  Add water with yeast and vegetable oil. Stir with a spoon and then use your hands to form the dough into a ball.  Knead the dough into a lightly oiled bowl, cover it and store it in a warm place for about 45 minutes or until the dough doubles in size.
3. When dough has risen, preheat oven to 425 degrees.
4. Make a bath for the pretzels by combining the baking soda with the warm water and stir until baking soda is mostly dissolved.
5. Remove the dough from the bowl and divide it into 8 even portions.  Roll each portion on a flat non-floured surface until it is about 3 feet long. Pick up both ends of the dough and give it a little spin so the middle of the dough spins around once.  Lay the dough down with the loop nearest to you.  Fold the ends down toward you and pinch to attch them to the bottom of the loop.  The twist should be in the middle and it should look like a pretzel.  We have also just cut them into bite sizes which works really well for finger snacks.
6. Holding the pinched ends, dip each pretzel into the bath solution.  Put each pretzel on a paper towel for a moment to blot the excess liquid.  Arrange the pretzels on a baking sheet sprayed with non-stick spray.  If you want salt, sprinkle pretzels with kosher or pretzel salt.  Don't salt any pretzels you plan to coat with cinnamon/sugar. You will likely have to use two baking sheets, and be sure to bake them separately.  Bake the pretzels for 4 minutes, then spin the pan halfway around and bake for another 4 to 5 minutes or until the pretzels are golden brown.
7. Remove the pretzels from the oven and let them cool for a couple of minutes.  If you want to eat some now, brush with melted butter first, if desired, before serving.  If you want the cinnamon/sugar coating, make it by combining the 1/2 cup sugar and 2 tsp cinnamon in a small bowl.  Brush the unsalted pretzels with a generous amount of melted butter.  Sprinkle a heavy coating of the cinnamon/sugar onto the entire surface of the pretzels over a plate.  Munch out.

Credit: http://www.TopSecretRecipes.com

Makes 8 pretzels
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Lemon Butter for Plank Chicken
directions:
This is the recipe that use with plank chicken, but it's also tasty for anytime you want a lemon butter sauce.

Reduce the wine and lemon juice with the shallots (you can use garlic if you don't have shallots) for 2 minutes. Add the cream and reduce for 2 minutes.  Using a whisk, slowly encorporate the butter.  Season with pepper to taste.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Plank chicken
directions:
Soak planks for at least 1 hour in water.

Preheat grill.

Mix together all the seasonings in a small bowl.  

Cut potatoes into small cubes and put in a small casserole dish with the butter and some of the seasonings.  Cook in the microwave for 2 minutes, then stir.  Repeat cooking for 2 minutes and stirring until they start to soften.  If you don't stir often they will not cook evenly.

Cut chicken breasts into strips, about 3 per breast.  Coat the chicken in the seasoning mix.

When the potatoes are done, remove the planks from the water.  Arrange the chicken and potatoes on the planks so that the pieces of chicken do not touch each other.  

Put the planks on the grill and cook with the cover down for about 20 minutes.  While the chicken is cooking, make the "Lemon Butter for Plank Chicken" recipe found under sauces.  When the chicken is done, serve on the planks with the sauce.

You can also experiment with adding other vegetables or meats.  I have tried this with steak or shrimp and it works well.  Adding onions, zuchinni, peppers or any other veg works well.  If the veg takes a long time to cook like potatoes or carrots, then you need to cook them ahead of time before putting them on the plank.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Sweet Egg-Free Pancakes
directions:
!!!! Note: qty in parens is for 10x batch !!!!

Sift together dry ingredients... mix together wet ingredients in separate bowl.  Add wet to dry mixing until combined, do no overmix or pancakes will be tough.  Heat a NONSTICK pan with a bit of veg oil and cook.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Apple Pancakes
directions:
1. In a large bowl combine butter, egg, milk and apple.  In a separate bowl combine all dry ingredients.  Stir dry ingredients into the wet ones.  Cook like normal pancakes.

*Note - if making lactose free pancakes, the egg substitute and silk make them too chewy.  Add some water to thin the mix so that they will spread out - or I'd like to try replacing the egg substitute with oil instead to see if that makes them cook better.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Chili
directions:
In a large pan cook beef, onion and green pepper until meat is browned.  Drain if necessary.  Add kidney beans with the juice, tomatoes with the juice and all other ingredients.  Simmer, covered, for 30 minutes or longer.  

Note - We like a LOT of chili powder.  More conservative tastes may wish to start at 2 tsp and work their way up.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Chicken and Orange Casserole
directions:
If using full chickens, trim the fat and remove the skin, then cut each chicken into 8 pieces and discard the backbones.  If using chicken breasts, trim the fat and cut each breast into 3 or 4 pieces.

Heat a teaspoon of olive oil in a large, deep, heavy based pan.  Add the bacon and cook over medium heat for 2-3 minutes or until just crisp.  Remove from the pan and set on paper towels to drain.  Add the remaining oil and 2 tbl butter to the pan.  Add onions to pan and cook until dark golden brown - stirring often to keep them browning evenly.  Remove onions from pan and set aside.

Add the chicken pieces to the pan and brown over medium heat.  Remove from pan and drain on paper towels.  

Add the remaining butter to the pan.  Stir in the garlic, ginger, orange rind, cumin, cardamom and honey.  Cook, stirring for one minute.  Add the orange juice, wine and chicken stock to the pan.  Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer.  Return the chicken pieces, onions, bacon to the pan and add the carrots.  Cook until the carrots are tender - 15 to 20 minutes.  

*Notes - I added about a tablespoon of gravy flour to thicken the sauce.  The original version of this recipe adds only the chicken back into the sauce at first, cooks covered for 40 minutes, then adds the onions and bacon back in and cooks for another 15 minutes, covered.  Then they add in the carrots and cook until they are tender.  I have never tried this because I never have that kind of time, so it might be awesome.  My version takes about an hour less to cook and there are no leftovers.  I also note that I specify the type of orange juice.  This recipe wasn't sponsored by Minute Maid, it's just that I find Tropicana far too bitter to use in a sauce.  I also find that the low acid version is much easier on everyone's stomach.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Fajita Seasoning 2
directions:
Note: May want to reduce salt a bit... reduce cayenne and red pepper to make more mild.

Combine all ingredients and mix well - equivalent to 3 packets of commercial seasoning packets.

Heat pan with oil until hot.  Add meat and cook for about 5 minutes... add about 3 tbl seasoning mix, onions, peppers, etc.  Mix well and cook until tender.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Blueberry Babies (Muffins)
directions:
Preheat oven to 400 deg.  Butter 12 standard muffin tins.
Mix together dry ingredients.  In separate bowl wisk together liquid ingredients.
Combine wet/dry and mix until just combined.
Gently stir in blueberries
Divide among muffin tins.  Sprinkle tops with a bit of sugar if desired.

Bake 15-20 (20 for egg/milk subst) minutes or until they pass toothpick test.   Let cool 5 minutes before removing from tins.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Crepes - Owen Safe
directions: Mix up the egg substitute (Ener-G Egg egg replacer).  Add everything into a blender and blend.  Cook thin crepes in a crepe pan or skillet over medium high heat.  You need higher heat with the Silk than you do with the milk version.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Scones - Owen Safe
directions:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees

Whisk together flour, baking powder, salt and sugar in a large bowl (or 6 one second pulses in a food processor). 
Cut in the shortening and Smart Balance (or 12 one second pulses in a food processor).
Transfer to a large bowl, add Silk and stir about 30 seconds, then knead for about 10 seconds into a a sticky ball.
Press dough into a greased 8 inch round cake pan and then flip over onto parchment paper.  Cut the dough into 8 wedges (like a pizza).
Put wedges on parchment paper on a cookie sheet, and bake 12-15 minutes until tops are golden brown.

**Notes- OK, that's the official version of how to put them on the pan. Personally I find that with 1 cup of liquid the dough is way too wet to do this with.  I have added more flour or cut back on the liquid to make it possible to form them, but as it turns out the scones don't taste quite as good. So instead I just roll out the parchment paper and spoon six globs onto it.  I flatten out the globs with my fingers and sprinkle some sugar on top before baking.  My friend Val also uses an ice cream scoop to put out nice little blobs and that works well too.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Blueberry Coffee Cake
directions: Mix dry ingredients and set aside.  Beat shortening, sugar, egg, and vanilla.  Add milk and dry ingredients.  Fold in blueberries.  Spread in pan.  Blend topping ingredients and sprinkle evenly over top.  Bake at 375 deg for 30 min (for 9x9 pan) or ~40 min (for 8x8 pan).
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Pizza Dough with Honey
directions:
Pour water, honey, salt into food processor and mix for 15 seconds.  Add yeast and mix for 5 seconds.  Add 1 cup flour and mix for 10 seconds.  Add olive oil and mix until blended.  Add the rest of the flour and mix until dough forms a ball that rolls around the processor.  

Take dough out and knead for a minute or so.  Let raise in a warm, dry place for 30 minutes (or doubled in size).  Punch down and let rise again to about double it's original size again.  

Spread out on preheated pizza stone, cover with toppings, cook at 425 degrees.  

Makes enough for two large pizzas, plus a little one.  I haven't tried halving the recipe yet, but if you don't want a lot of pizza I would suggest doing so.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Pizza Sauce - Italian
directions: Mix all ingredients in a sauce pan, cook on low for 2 or 3 hours.  Makes enough for 3 pizzas.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Mom's Chicken
directions:
1.  Preheat oven to 350 degrees F

2.  In a medium bowl, combine the barbecue sauce, plum jam, and onion soup mix.  Place the chicken
    pieces in a 9 X 13 baking dish and pour mixture over chicken, coating thoroughly.

3.  Bake at 350 degrees for about 1 hour, or until chicken juices run clear.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Plum Jam  Chicken
directions:
1.  Preheat oven to 350 degrees.

2.  In a medium  bowl, combine the barbecue sauce, plum jam and onion soup mix.  Place the chicken in a 9 X 13 baking dish and pour mixture over the chicken, coating thoroughly.

3.  Bake at 350 degrees for about 1 hour, or until chicken juices run clear.
author: Connie Quackenbush

name: Enchilada Sauce
directions:
In 2 quart saucepan, add chicken broth, chili powder, garlic powder, cumin, salt, cinnamon, and sugar.

Whisk often while heating to boil.  Reduce heat to low and simmer for 3 minutes.  Whisk often.

In small bowl, add 5 tbl water and whisk in 5 tbl flour 1 tbl at a time making sure to eliminate all lumps.

Turn heat up to high and slowly whisk is flour/water mixture.  Turn heat to medium and continue to whisk for 1 minute more.

Turn off heat... sauce is done.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Country Fried Hamburger Steaks with Gravy
directions:
Beat together egg and milk in shallow bowl.  In separate dish mix flour with seasoned salt, pepper and garlic powder.  Flatten each burger to 1/4 in. thick... break into smaller pieces if necessary.

Heat oil until it's hot but not smoking.  Dip each piece of meat into egg mixture and dredge in flour to coat.  Fry in oil until both sides are golden brown.

Drain all but 3 tbl oil from pan and stir in flour left from dredging until a paste is formed.  Stir for 5 minutes over medium heat to eliminate raw flour taste.  Whisk in warm milk until gravy of desired thickness is formed.

Serve "steaks" over mashed potatoes with gravy over the top.  Yum.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Swiss Cheese & White Wine Sauce
directions: Quickly brown the proscuitto in a little bit of butter.  Remove from pan.  Melt the butter over low heat. Slowly add the flour and cook to make a roux. Keeping the heat low, whisk in the warm milk.  Melt in the grated cheese.  Add the wine, proscuitto and a couple of dashes of nutmeg and pepper.  Let simmer for a few minutes to let the flavors combine, serve warm.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Tostada Beef
directions:
This is a great way to get rid of a tough roast in a yummy way.  Cut roast into a few big chunks, remove any bones and big pieces of fat. Very lightly dredge the pieces in flour.  

Heat oil in a large dutch oven, then brown the roast.  Remove the roast from the pot and add the onions and cook them until they are translucent.  Add tomato sauce, garlic, bullion, cilantro, chili powder, oregano, cayenne pepper (optional) and water.  Mix together.  Replace the beef, cover and cook for at least 4 hours or until it falls apart.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Mexican Cheese Sauce
directions:
Melt butter in bowl, whisk in flour.  Whisk in milk and microwave until hot.  Add cheese and whisk in, microwave 30 seconds at a time until smooth and creamy.  Season with salt and pepper to taste... can add some chopped green chili or onions.

Good for chimichangas or just dipping chips.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Chimichangas
directions:
Cook bacon in skillet, breaking up pieces.  When it's about done, add onion and saute.
Lower heat, add chilies, salt, oregano, chili powder and cilantro, simmer 2-3 minutes
Add meat and tomatoes, simmer 2-3 minutes
Place 1/2 cup meat filling in each tortilla, roll/fold like a burrito
Fry, seam side down in about 1/2 inch hot oil until mildly crispy and brown
Turn and brown on other side then drain for a moment on paper towels.
Place on plate and top with shredded cheese, sour cream and salsa.  Place some lettuce next to burrito.  Spoon some Mexican cheese sauce over the top if available.  

Yum.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Rugalach Cookies
directions:
1st Day:  mix butter, cream cheese and salt until creamy.  Mix in flour.  Shape mixture into 14 balls.  Lightly cover and refrigerate overnight.

2nd Day:  Mix pecans, sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl to make filling.  On lightly floured board, roll each ball into a 6 inch circle.  Cut each into quarters.  Fill with filling mixture.  Fold over and pinch with fork to form a wedge.  Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 12-14 minutes (not quite brown).
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Soy-Marinated London Broil
directions:
Mix soy sauce, brown sugar and garlic until sugar dissolves.  Dry meat with paper towles and marinade for 20-30 minutes.

Place meat in foil covered roasting pan and broil for 5 minutes on each side for medium rare.  While meat is broiling, saute onion over high heat until nicely brown then add remaining marindade and simmer for 5 minutes over low heat.

 Remove meat and cover tightly with foil for 5 minutes before slicing thinly.  Serve meat topped with a spoon of marinade/onion mixture sprinkled with a bit of seasame seeds.

Goes good with mashed potatoes or rice.
author: Chris Higgins

name: One Bowl Chocolate Cake
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.  Grease and flour two nine inch round pans

2. In a large bowl, stir together the sugar, flour, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda and salt.  Add the eggs, milk, oil and vanilla, mix for 2 minutes on medium speed with a mixer.  Stir in the boiling water last.  Batter will be thin.  Pour evenly into the prepared pans. 

3. Bake 30 - 35 minutes in the preheated oven, until the cake tests done with a toothpick.  Cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then remove to a wire rack to cool complete before frosting.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Caramels
directions:
Grease a 4 x 4 pan or Tupperware container.

Melt butter in a heavy saucepan over medium heat.  Add brown sugar and salt, stir until combined.  Stir in corn syrup and mix thoroughly.  Gradually add the sweetened condensed milk, stirring constantly.  

Keep stirring until mixture reaches 245 degrees on a candy thermometer.  Turn off the heat.  Add the vanilla and mix it in.  Immediately pour it into the pan.  Wait for it to cool completely, then remove the remove the caramel from the pan in one piece.  Cut with kitchen scissors into small pieces and wrap them with wax paper.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Chicken with Apple Cider Dumplings
directions:
Cut chicken into large pieces.  Start potatoes in microwave til mostly cooked, stirring every minute.  In a large, deep skillet brown chicken in olive oil and butter.  Remove chicken from pan.  Add in the onion, parsely, salt and pepper and cook until onions are tender.  Add in flour and mix well.  Add in broth and cider and return chicken to the skillet.  

In a separate bowl mix a normal batch of dumplings according to the directions on the Bisquick box.  Spoon the mix into the skillet and cook according to the directions on the box - 10 minutes uncovered and 10 minutes covered.  

You can also add carrots or other veg if you wish.
author: Michelle Higgins

name: Eye Round Roast
directions:
Salt the roast, wrap in saran wrap and refridgerate 18-24 hours

Preheat oven to 225 degrees

Pat dry the roast, rub with 2 tsp oil and some freshly cracked pepper.  Sear in hot skillet on all sides - about 3 minutes per side - til deeply brown.

Put on roasting rack in preheated oven.  Roast until thermometer reaches 
115 for med-rare
125 for medium

1-3/4 hrs to 2-1/4 depending on size (3.5 to 4.5 lbs)

Turn off oven.  Leave roast in oven and do not open door until roast measures 
130 for med-rare
140 for medium

which will be 30-50 minutes longer.  

Rest 15 minutes and slice thinly.
author: Michelle Higgins
